verses.verse: Woe<WH480> is me! For I am<WH1961> Like the fruit<WH7019> pickers<WH625> and the grape<WH1210> gatherers.<WH5955> There<WH369> is not a cluster<WH811> of grapes to eat,<WH398> [Or] a first-ripe fig<WH1063> [which] I crave.<WH183>

The godly<WH2623> person<WH2623> has perished from the land,<WH6> And there<WH776> is no<WH369> upright<WH369> [person] among men.<WH3477> All<WH120> of them lie<WH3605> in wait<WH693> for bloodshed;<WH693> Each<WH1818> of them hunts<WH376> the other<WH6679> with a net.<WH251>

Concerning<WH5921> evil,<WH9563> both hands<WH3709> do<WH3190> it well.<WH3190> The prince<WH8269> asks,<WH7592> also the judge,<WH8199> for a bribe,<WH7966> And a great<WH1419> man<WH1419> speaks<WH1696> the desire<WH1942> of his soul;<WH5315> So they weave<WH5686> it together.<WH5686>

The best<WH2896> of them is like a briar,<WH2312> The most upright<WH3477> like a thorn<WH4534> hedge.<WH4534> The day<WH3117> when you post a watchman,<WH6822> Your punishment<WH6486> will come.<WH935> Then<WH6258> their confusion<WH3998> will occur.<WH1961>
Do not trust<WH982> in a neighbor;<WH7453> Do not have<WH982> confidence<WH982> in a friend.<WH7453> From her who lies<WH7901> in your bosom<WH2436> Guard<WH8104> your lips.<WH6310>

For son<WH1121> treats<WH9310> father contemptuously,<WH1> Daughter<WH9310> rises<WH1323> up against her mother,<WH6965> Daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law; A man's enemies<WH517> are the men<WH340> of his own household.<WH376>
But as for me, I will watch<WH6822> expectantly<WH6822> for the Lord;<WH3068> I will wait<WH3176> for the God<WH430> of my salvation.<WH3468> My God<WH430> will hear<WH8085> me.
Do not rejoice<WH8055> over me, O my enemy.<WH340> Though<WH3588> I fall<WH5307> I will rise;<WH6965> Though<WH3588> I dwell<WH3427> in darkness,<WH2822> the Lord<WH3068> is a light<WH216> for me.

I will bear<WH5375> the indignation<WH2197> of the Lord<WH3068> Because<WH3588> I have sinned<WH2398> against Him, Until<WH5704> <WH834> He pleads<WH7378> my case<WH7379> and executes<WH6213> justice<WH4941> for me. He will bring<WH3318> me out to the light,<WH216> [And] I will see<WH7200> His righteousness.<WH6666>

Then my enemy<WH340> will see,<WH7200> And shame<WH955> will cover<WH3680> her who said<WH559> to me, "Where<WH335> is the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430>?" My eyes<WH5869> will look<WH7200> on her; At that time<WH6258> she will be trampled<WH4823> down,<WH4823> Like mire<WH2916> of the streets.<WH2351>
[It will be] a day<WH3117> for building<WH1129> your walls.<WH1447> On that day<WH3117> will your boundary<WH2706> be extended.<WH7368>

It [will be] a day<WH3117> when they will come<WH935> to you From Assyria<WH804> and the cities<WH5892> of Egypt,<WH4693> From Egypt<WH4693> even to the Euphrates,<WH5104> Even from sea<WH3220> to sea<WH3220> and mountain<WH2022> to mountain.<WH2022>
And the earth<WH776> will become<WH1961> desolate<WH8077> because<WH5921> of her inhabitants,<WH3427> On account<WH4480> of the fruit<WH6529> of their deeds.<WH4611>

Shepherd<WH7462> Thy people<WH5971> with Thy scepter,<WH7626> The flock<WH6629> of Thy possession<WH5159> Which dwells<WH7931> by itself<WH910> in the woodland,<WH3293> In the midst<WH8432> of a fruitful<WH3759> field.<WH3759> Let them feed<WH7462> in Bashan<WH1316> and Gilead<WH1568> As in the days<WH3117> of old.<WH5769>
"As in the days<WH3117> when you came<WH3318> out from the land<WH776> of Egypt,<WH4714> I will show<WH7200> you miracles.<WH6381>"
Nations<WH1471> will see<WH7200> and be ashamed<WH954> Of all<WH3605> their might.<WH1369> They will put<WH7760> [their] hand<WH3027> on [their] mouth,<WH6310> Their ears<WH241> will be deaf.<WH2790>

They will lick<WH3897> the dust<WH6083> like a serpent,<WH5175> Like reptiles<WH9102> of the earth.<WH776> They will come<WH7264> trembling<WH7264> out of their fortresses;<WH4526> To the Lord<WH3068> our God<WH430> they will come<WH6342> in dread,<WH6342> And they will be afraid<WH3372> before<WH4480> Thee.

Who<WH4310> is a God<WH410> like<WH3644> Thee, who pardons<WH5375> iniquity<WH5771> And passes<WH5674> over<WH5921> the rebellious<WH6588> act<WH6588> of the remnant<WH7611> of His possession<WH5159>? He does not retain<WH2388> His anger<WH639> forever,<WH5703> Because<WH3588> He delights<WH2654> in unchanging<WH2617> love.<WH2617>

He will again<WH7725> have<WH7355> compassion<WH7355> on us; He will tread<WH3533> our iniquities<WH5771> under<WH3533> foot.<WH3533> Yes, Thou wilt cast<WH7993> all<WH3605> their sins<WH9128> Into the depths<WH4688> of the sea.<WH3220>

Thou wilt give<WH5414> truth<WH571> to Jacob<WH3290> [And] unchanging<WH2617> love<WH2617> to Abraham,<WH85> Which<WH834> Thou didst swear<WH7650> to our forefathers From the days<WH1> of old.<WH3117>
